basics.name: Aravind S
basics.summary: I am a robotics engineer with a strong background in control systems, reinforcement learning, and autonomous systems.

work.name: Mathworks Pvt Ltd
work.summary: I work on MATLAB support for robotics and control systems, including intelligent bin picking with ROS2 and UR5e, and integrating MATLAB/Simulink with the Crazyflie drone via Crazyradio.

work.name: NVIDIA Graphics Pvt Ltd
work.summary: Worked on report generation for GPU Performance tests. Required to design and write highly optimized, scalable, and maintainable code to generate HTML reports. Also worked on the UI for the HTML reports. Worked on optimizing C++ build time of projects in Windows and Linux.

work.name: Nokia Solutions & Networks Pvt Ltd
work.summary: Worked on companion computer adaptation to change in flight controller for drones used in Nokia Drone Networks.

awards.title: CNR Rao Scholarship
awards.summary: The CNR Rao Scholarship is a monetary scholarship awarded to in recofnition of the academic achievements of students who stand within the top 10% of the university.

publications.name: Reinforcement Learning Based Persistent Surveillance on Graphs Under Energy Constraints
publications.summary: We address energy-constrained persistent surveillance by routing a single agent on a graph using a D3QN-based rolling horizon algorithm to minimize weighted idleness and reporting delay. Our method achieves near-optimal performance with significantly lower computation time compared to IP solvers and outperforms five benchmark approaches.

projects.name: Multi-Agent Surveillance over Large Graphs
projects.summary: Designed and developed a scalable deep reinforcement learning algorithm to perform persistent surveillance over large graphs using multiple agents.

projects.name: Design of a Funnel Controller for Given STL Specifications
projects.summary: Implemented a funnel controller for an omnibot that satisfies spatio-temporal logic (STL) specifications, with verification via simulation and hardware testing.
highlights: Tested in Gazebo and real-world hardware

projects.name: Deep RL Based Control for a Quadrotor
projects.summary: Developed deep reinforcement learning-based position and attitude controllers for a quadrotor using the PyBullet simulator for training and validation.

projects.name: Robust Control on a Drone
projects.summary: Designed and implemented a UDE-based robust control system for quadrotor position and attitude stabilization, with hardware validation.

projects.name: Self-Balancing Robot Using LQR-Based Feedback Control
projects.summary: Built a two-wheeled self-balancing robot with an LQR-based controller, validated through both simulation and hardware testing.

projects.name: Efficient Path Planning of Unmanned Surface Vehicle (USV)
projects.summary: Implemented the AMRA* algorithm for USV path planning in complex environments like the Sunderbans delta and benchmarked against other planning algorithms.

projects.name: Map Auto Generation | Nokia Bell Labs
projects.summary: Used TurtleBot to autonomously explore and map unknown environments using Frontier Exploration and SLAM algorithms.

projects.name: AQPAC | Air Quality Predictor and Checker
projects.summary: Built a wireless sensor network to monitor air quality and display results through a website and Android app. Focused on sensor node development and communication protocols.

projects.name: Incentivized TechBin | Smart Garbage Collector
projects.summary: Developed a smart bin with sensors and an Android app to incentivize garbage disposal based on waste type and quantity.

projects.name: Study of Average Reward TRPO for Infinite Horizon Control Problems
projects.summary: Implemented and analyzed the average reward variant of TRPO for infinite horizon control tasks, with validation via simulations.
highlights: Adapted TRPO for average reward objective
